rev.comment: Reverted to revision 297382694 by [[Special:Contributions/IllaZilla|IllaZilla]]; image is not useful. ([[WP:TW|TW]])

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 293557884 by [[Special:Contributions/Bakartkung|Bakartkung]] ([[User talk:Bakartkung|talk]]) pop punk is not one of the stylistic origins. read the article.
Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Dominus Noster|Dominus Noster]]; Sorry, it's not.. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Added some information which I think is relevant.
rv. the point is that many reliable sources have described them as emo (which they have). that's all the sentence says; it does not say that they are or aren't emo.
rv POV edit from user continually insisting (without any reliable sources for verification) that emo is (in his opinion) no longer popular.
it is not "slanderous to the movement"; it's an authoritative source describing 1 of the style's tropes. the header describes the criticism levied in that paragraph, just as the following headers do.
/* Misogyny */In this section, the only assertions of misogyny in emo comes from 1 source. It's slanderous to the movement to use the term unattributed, since it's on the basis of 1 opinion.
rv POV edits. see talk page. the term's search rates on the internet are not an indication of the style's level of popularity.
restored content lost in previous edits: entire chunk cut out of history which orphaned some ref's, OR in the lead, keyboards, though sometimes used, are not common to the style
continuing work on the history, getting into the screamo stuff. took out the last couple of paragraphs but saved the ref's in my userspace to be re-used later.
adding alternative rock as a category
rv. again, plesae use the talk page to discuss these changes. further repetition of the same without discussion will be treated as vandalism
for the last time, stop gutting the history. there is no [[WP:CON|consensus]] that these sections are too long or need to be removed.
Rescuing orphaned refs ("Greenwald, 119" from rev 289780608; "Greenwald, 33" from rev 289780608)
removing the part that says pop punk is an origin, keeping the rest

origins" refers to the ORIGIN of the style, which happened in the mid-'80s. it originated from hardcore & indie rock, not pop-punk. please discuss these changes on the talk page before editing further
there is MAJOR pop punk influence and crossover in emo
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Mimzy1990|Mimzy1990]] to last revision by ([[WP:HG|HG]])
keyboards are a major component - hellogoodbye and cobra starship are not emo?
rv again; none of this seems helpful. pop punk is not one of the origins, keyboards are not a common instrument in the style, and the practice of linking dates is long deprecated.
yes, there are repeated statements. nirvana's break in 1991 was mentioned twice.
rv again. these are not "repeated statements". the purpose of the lead section is to provide a concise summary of the article as an introduction to it.
rv to last good version. why did you butcher out entire sections of the history and most of the lead? there were also POV statements in there ("Labeling a band "emo" often became a way to insult...")
removing unneccesary parts to make article cleaner and more concise
cmon. the history of emo is not that complex. if it is, people can buy the book that's sourced. it's too much for a wiki article.
cleanup - just way too long - emo is not THAT complex ....
Reverted 8 edits by [[Special:Contributions/Mimzy1990|Mimzy1990]]; Rm POV edits with unreliable sources. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 289625443 by [[Special:Contributions/Mimzy1990|Mimzy1990]] ([[User talk:Mimzy1990|talk]]) all of a sudden it's no longer popular? that was fast. (POV, basically)

/* Origins: 1980s */ one man's opinion does not indicate they are not commonly recognized as an emo band; more sources are needed if this wording is to remain
/* Mainstream popularity: 2000s */ getting back to this section
rewording paragraph on origins of term, adding additional citations

I have reservations about this. the source requires a subscription to view, it contradicts what the other source says, & there's video evidence of "emocore" being used as far back as the mid-80s
Additional info on origins of the term
does not apply. A) there is no discussion on the talk page suggesting that the article has an NPOV problem; B) there does not seem to be any synthesis; C) it is under construction

the field displays as "mainstream popularity", not "underground popularity"
cleaning up the lead. the lead shouldn't require citations as it's merely a summary of/introduction to the rest of the article
infobox cleanup. no need for "early"/"late" disclaimers. origins means beginning. screamo is a subgenre

rm merge tag, article has been AfD'd and there is nothing in it to merge here; all of its contents are already covered here.
added a reference that was used in the [[What Is Emo]] article. seems pertinent, & I plan to mark that other article for deletion.

fact; reword is this is a typical straw man argument (i.e., assuming that individuals simultaneously claim to be anti-conformist whilst conforming, when it may be they never make that claim)

not clear how emotion is related to sexuality - these are separate issues
